data.title: Fun, quirky hotel
data.text: It's got a modern look to it, so it's got more character than your standard chain hotel.  (The robe provided was leopard print!)  Breakfast buffet was good in the morning, and there was a nice lounge area with funky but comfortable places to chat.  I was sorry I got in too late to take advantage of the complimentary glass of wine at 5 PM.

data.title: Red Velvet drape as closet door....opens to find leopard print bath robe.
data.text:
Loved the small, quaint reception area adjacent to the front desk. Complimentary evening wine gives one the opportunity to meet other interesting travelers. 
Rooms are large and baths are extra spacious.  I had DND on door during my two day stay and passing maid in the hallway, she asked if she could freshen my room. Nice personal touch.

data.title: Very chic, very boutique
data.text: I prefer boutique hotels.  But when I travel for business, I stick with basic.  I LUCKED OUT on my business trip to DC.  I was delighted with the ecclectic and RED luxury of this Kimpton property.  The 1940's Hollywood theme was fun.  The staff was exceptionally friendly and warm, accommodating and flexible.  That was good because I was traveling with two kids. They upgraded us at no charge to a suite with bunk beds and an X Box.  I walked to the convention center everyday (0.7 miles) without problem.  And among the conference hotels, this was the best price as well.  NOT BASIC! YAY!

data.title: A hotel with a customer in mind
data.text:
Kimpton Rouge Hotel, has a customer's needs in mind from the time you walk in. Lobby is very beautiful, with a warm welcome from the staff. 

After checking in, which took a few minutes by the way, I moved to my room. I was impressed with what I saw. There was detail to everything from the bed, lighting, working space and the bathroom. 

At this hotel it's easy to feel like you are back home because there is enough to keep one busy in the room.

The view from my room was breath taking more so at sunrise. 

Before I end this note thought would share that from 5-6 pm there is wine tasting so when you stay at the hotel, always remember to get some wine and if you miss it the happy hour at the bar could be what you need next.

data.title: Eclectic Room Decor..
data.text: Stayed here for one night to attend a meeting. My hotel room was large and was tastefully decorated! Wish I had time to stay an extra night because the rate was very reasonable for DC. The hotel is in a great location, in walking distance to the metro and to great restaurants. Forgot to mention that all the staff I had an encounter with were all pleasant and very helpful.

data.title: Hotel rouge Washington
data.text: This hotel is styled like a old 70s film throwback. Bright red walls. Small reception. Little amenities. The staff are friendly. The breakfast is expensive and poor. The fitness centre is in the basement and it's not great. The bar closes early. It's in a good location but no more than a very basic 3 star. Expect road noise. It was clean and for a business trip was ok apart from the breakfast. I've stayed in much better hotels for business trips.

data.title: Funky hotel with great service
data.text: As with most Kimpton brands, the Rouge is unusually hip and cool.  Looking beyond that,the pluses are customer service from the front desk to the bar, the room size was enormous, the desk lighting was bright enough to use for work, the free wine hour and the silence at night.the downsides are breakfast with virtually no dietary restriction considerations (no GF, little vegan), fitness room was tiny and smelled like urine, no in room coffee and the cock roach in my bathroom at 10 pm.  Overall, the location was pretty good -near DuPont Circle. restaurants are within walking distance.

data.title: A hotel with character
data.text: Nice hotel with very big rooms super comfy bed but small bathroom. Good location within walking distance from bars and restaurants. Very helpful staff. Breakfast very basic and expensive wi fi. Overall good+

data.title: Loved this Hotel
data.text: This was our first time at the Rouge.  It is not "new" but has a great feel to it.  The rooms are as depicted in the photo and we were very comfortable.  The staff was very knowledgeable about the area and made great recommendations about where to eat, how to get around and the best times to do specific activites.  They are pet friendly, and we loved seeing dogs in the lobby as we were missing ours at home so much.

data.title: One of Our Best trips to  DC
data.text: From Check in to check out everything was perfect. The staff at the Rouge really made it our stay wonderful. Tiara and Damian went out of their way to make our trip special. We were there for our son's wedding for four nights. The location was perfect for dining out and sight seeing. All within walking distance. We were sad to leave as the staff made us feel like family. There were hugs all around on our departure.

data.title: Really nice
data.text: First time at the Rouge. Great location, big room! Staff is very friendly, especially Tiara. Problem with 'bad keys,' but everyone is very helpful. Currently enjoying my complimentary wine-what could be better?

data.title: Lovely Boutique Hotel
data.text:
Stayed here for 4 nights and had a great stay. We had a huge room on the top floor which had ample space for bags and had the most comfortable bed! There was a well stocked mini bar, big wardrobe, and a safe. The staff were so friendly and helpful. 

It was about 15/20 minutes walking to the White House and just beyond was he national mall and about 15 minutes from union station in a cab.

data.title: Comfortable stay
data.text:
We were in DC for business and stayed at The Rouge. Convenient location with a young but attentive staff.  The breakfast room was the only downside, as the name Rouge would imply, the dining room/bar is very Red.  One has to ask for 
everything (multiple times) starting with the serviette, salt & pepper, water basically everything. The rooms are clean and comfortable, overall this is a decent 3 star property.

data.title: Very nice hotel!
data.text: The whole hotel staff was wonderful.  Never did valet parking before, but had a wonderful experience with that.  The front desk was very attentive to my needs and even called up to my room, once I settled in, and asked if everything was okay.  We had a great view of the city and the room was very inviting.  The His & Hers robes was a great addition!  I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting D.C.!!!

data.title: Not up to Kimpton Standards
data.text: I usually love Kimpton properties and book them whenever I can, in cities that include New York, DC, Chicago and Boston among others.  Never have I been so disappointed with a Kimpton as much as I have been with the Hotel Rouge in DC.  I booked it for my boss and she reported back that the service was bad and the hotel condition was not good.  On top of that, I called them 5 times trying to get them to send me a copy of her folio - FIVE TIMES over the course of several days.  They kept saying they would send it and NEVER DID.  So while I love Kimpton hotels, I never will book anyone at the Rouge in DC again.  There are a lot of Kimpton properties in DC - no need to ever book the Rouge.

data.title: One of the best in D.C.
data.text: I stayed here during a conference in Sept/Oct '16 and it was an all-round excellent experience. I had friends staying at the doubletree round the corner and found the Kimpton to have a nicer decor, service and facilities. Friendly, helpful staff with a clear passion for service.

data.title: Funky convenient & a great experience.
data.text:
Booked to stay at the Rouge hotel as leg 1 of a stint through DC / NYC & Boston, on arriving at the hotel we were greeted by two friendly members of staff who upgraded our rooms to suites for no reason in particular other than there own generosity and willingness to make a good impression.

The rooms were wonderful full of "Rouge" coloured items as you would expect filled with funky decor and big comfy beds. 

The hotel itself is located a stones throw (6-7 minute) walk from the White House and from there your pretty close to everything you need to be. There are local bars and restaurants again all in walking distance so nothin is out of the way or too far away.

I would certainly stay there again given the choice it had almost hard rock hotel feel to it with a slashed price mark.

For those of you needing to know or relying on it the hotel does also provide FREE and good speed Wifi.

A pleasant and enjoyable experience.

data.title: Great hotel and location
data.text:
Stayed here recently for 5 nights whilst visiting Washington DC for the first time.

The hotel is in a great location.. about 15mins walk to the White House and close by to supermarket and coffee shops. 

The hotel is very in keeping with its name it is nicely decorated and the theme runs throughout... red walls black sparkling floors. On arrival check in was quick and easy but staff didn't give any info on the hotel such as resturant times etc. There is no complementary WiFi,  however there are plenty of Starbucks coffee shops nearby that do!

Our room was located on the 5th floor at the front of the hotel, it was on the main road but this didn't disturb us... room had a very large bed, TV, safe, iron and ironing board, umbrella, dressing gowns and hairdryer. There were toiletries and you could also request things complementary such as nail clippers etc. There was a table and chairs and a mini bar fridge. 
There was no coffee/tea making facilities in the room but there was complementary tea/coffee in the mornings located in reception and you could request a coffee machine for your room. The hotel also put on complementary red and white wine between 1700-1800hrs every evening again located in reception and it was very pleasant sat in the bar area enjoying this. We were not told of this by the hotel we came across it on a previous review. 

We didn't eat in the restaurant whilst staying at the hotel but they did serve breakfast and dinner, we sat in the bar area in the evening sometimes and the food being ordered looked good. 

Overall great hotel and location, would recommend this hotel and stay here again.

data.title: Nice D.C. Hotel
data.text:
Stayed here for 5 days with wife and 1-year old. The room was spacious and the staff was very positive and service minded. The hotel design and decor is retro style (80s?). It would not hurt to modernize the rooms. 

My only compliant was the room cleaning, both the cleanliness when we checked in and the daily room cleaning. Staines in carpets, sofas, a lot of dust etc.

Location was perfect with a nice 15 minutes walk to the Mall. Lots of nice restaurants within 5 minutes walk.

data.title: Seen better days
data.text: Stayed here for 4 nights at the end of our trip.  Have stayed in several Kimpton properties so were looking forward to it.  We were checked into a large room on the top floor with 2 beds and a nice seating area.  Small bathroom compared to room.  This room was next to something to do with the hotel's air conditioning and there was a constant noise that never stopped.  Avoid this room if you don't want constant noise - it is 1016.  After 2 nights we asked for a move because of this noise which we were given with no problem.  The second room was also large and with a nice seating area.  The bathroom was also very small compared to the room and the air conditioning did not reach it so it got a little warm.  Bath with shower over bath, shower gel etc in dispensers attached to wall - not our favourite.  Room facilities fine, however the room in general (and the hotel itself) looked a little tired.  Worn carpet, slightly damaged furniture, heavy velvet drapes which had seen better days.  Very large mirror attached to wall and dusty behind, as was under the bed plinth. The hotel advertises tea and coffee in the lobby every morning as no machine in room (you can ask for a coffee machine in room).  We drink tea in the morning and every morning there was either no tea or only limited herbal - no black tea.  Every other Kimpton we have stayed in has had much better selection, so this was very disappointing.  There was no attempt to obtain any other teas for guests, which should be easy enough.  Hotel has no dining room so if you do eat it is in the bar area.  Breakfast is available and a limited evening menu.  We did not eat at the hotel, as a number of restaurants in easy walking distance.  Kimpton hotels have a wine hour every day and this was no exception.  Very welcome after a day's sightseeing.  All staff very helpful and friendly.  Could not fault them.  Also organised us a car to the airport.  Would look at alternative properties if staying in Washington again.
